solution_line_template: If Danielle drives at three times the speed of Cameron, it will take Cameron {danielle_travel_time}*{danielle_speed_multiplier}=<<{danielle_travel_time}*{danielle_speed_multiplier}={cameron_travel_time}>>{cameron_travel_time} minutes for Cameron to travel the same distance.

And since Cameron drives at twice the speed of his brother, Chase, it will take Chase {cameron_travel_time}*{cameron_speed_multiplier}=<<{cameron_travel_time}*{cameron_speed_multiplier}={chase_travel_time}>>{chase_travel_time} minutes to travel from Granville to Salisbury.
